summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney to defense counsel in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, transmitting a cover letter and an index of non-testifying witness material. The email discusses logistics for producing these materials via an FTP site.

persons.name: Christian R Everdell
persons.context: Appears as a recipient of the email, identified as being from Cohen & Gresser LLP.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Appears as a recipient of the email, presumably a colleague of Christian Everdell at Cohen & Gresser LLP.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Appears as a recipient of the email, representing Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Appears as a recipient of the email, representing Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Appears as a recipient of the email, representing Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case 'US v. Maxwell' referenced in the email subject line and attachment titles.

connections.description: Sternheim is listed as defense counsel receiving material in the case against Maxwell.
Menninger is listed as defense counsel receiving material in the case against Maxwell.
Pagliuca is listed as defense counsel receiving material in the case against Maxwell.
Both are listed as attorneys at Cohen & Gresser LLP and recipients of the prosecution's email.
Both are listed as defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell on the same email.

events.title: Preparation of Non-Testifying Witness Material
events.description: The prosecution prepared an index and cover letter for non-testifying witness material to be provided to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

locations.name: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
locations.context: The office from which the prosecuting attorney is corresponding.

locations.name: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
locations.context: The address of the United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: The prosecution in US v. Ghislaine Maxwell was preparing to disclose 'Non-Testifying Witness Material' to the defense in April 2021.
The material transmission was to be handled via an FTP site, as requested by the prosecution.
The defense team at this time included attorneys Bobbi Sternheim, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca.
The correspondence indicates ongoing pre-trial discovery and evidence sharing in the Maxwell case.
The email is a routine procedural communication regarding the logistics of evidence production.
